reporting-org.narrative: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR)

description.narrative: Cette activité montre les détails de l'opération du HCR au Kenya pour 2017, y compris le budget, les financements, les dépenses et les résultats.
This activity shows details of the UNHCR operation in Kenya for 2017 including the budget, funding, expenditure and results.

Le HCR, l'Agence des Nations Unies pour les réfugiés, est une organisation internationale qui a pour mission de sauver des vies, de protéger les droits des réfugiés et de construire un avenir meilleur pour les réfugiés, les communautés déplacées et les apatrides.
UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, is a global organisation dedicated to saving lives, protecting rights and building a better future for refugees, forcibly displaced communities and stateless people.

sector.narrative: Access to and quality of status determination procedures improved
Access to legal assistance and legal remedies improved
Access to the territory improved and risk of refoulement reduced
Camp management and coordination refined and improved
Civil registration and civil status documentation strengthened
Donor relations and resource mobilization strengthened
Greater reduction of statelessness is achieved
Health status of the population improved
Law and policy developed or strengthened
Logistics and supply optimized to serve operational needs
Natural resources and shared environment better protected
Operations management, coordination and support strengthened and optimized
Peaceful co-existence with local communities promoted
Population has optimal access to education
Population has optimal access to reproductive health and HIV services
Population has sufficient access to energy
Population has sufficient basic and domestic items
Population lives in satisfactory conditions of sanitation and hygiene
Public attitude towards persons of concern improved
Quality of registration and profiling improved or maintained
Relief co-ordination; protection and support services
Risk of SGBV is reduced and quality of response improved
Risks related to detention reduced and freedom of movement increased
Services for persons with specific needs strengthened
Shelter and infrastructure established, improved and maintained
Supply of potable water increased or maintained
